Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Drunken chicken" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(February 2013)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Drunken chicken** ([traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 醉雞; [simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 醉鸡; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *zuìjī*) is a way of preparing [chicken](/wiki/Chicken_(food)) using [alcoholic beverages](/wiki/Alcoholic_beverage). Different varieties of the dish exist in [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_cuisine), [Taiwanese](/wiki/Taiwanese_cuisine), [Malaysian](/wiki/Malaysian_cuisine), [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean_cuisine) cuisine. ## Varieties There are many different ways of cooking drunken chicken. One with [Shaoxing](/wiki/Shaoxing) wine originated in the [Zhejiang](/wiki/Zhejiang) province of eastern [China](/wiki/China). Shaoxing drunk chicken is cooked and [marinated](/wiki/Marinated) in [Shaoxing wine](/wiki/Shaoxing_wine) to create a deep taste. In another version of the dish, the whole chicken is first [steamed](/wiki/Steaming) then chopped up into pieces appropriately sized for picking up by [chopsticks](/wiki/Chopstick). The steamed meat, along with its juice, is cooked with [scallions](/wiki/Scallion), [ginger](/wiki/Ginger) and [salt](/wiki/Salt). After the chicken is cooked it is marinated in [liquor](/wiki/Chinese_alcoholic_beverage), [sherry](/wiki/Sherry) or a distilled liquor, like [whiskey](/wiki/Whiskey), overnight in the [refrigerator](/wiki/Refrigerator). The chicken is served chilled, often as an [appetizer](/wiki/Appetizer). Besides the liquor-flavored meat, another feature of the dish is the liquor-flavored [gelatin](/wiki/Gelatin) that results from the chilled mixture of the alcohol and the cooking juices. ## Similar dishes ### Greece Μεθυσμένο κοτόπουλο (methisméno kotópoulo) - drunken chicken - is a dish found with many variations in *taverna* in [Greece](/wiki/Greek_cuisine) and [Cyprus](/wiki/Cypriot_cuisine). Served as a [meze](/wiki/Meze) or a main course, the basic recipe consists of chicken breasts, marinated in alcohol (usually [ouzo](/wiki/Ouzo)), sautéed, then braised in the marinade. ### Latin America The [Argentine](/wiki/Argentine_cuisine), [Chilean](/wiki/Chilean_cuisine), and [Mexican](/wiki/Mexican_cuisine) versions of this dish are called *pollo borracho*, and usually include beer, chiles, and other spices. - [Coq au vin](/wiki/Coq_au_vin) - [Beer can chicken](/wiki/Beer_can_chicken) This [American cuisine](/wiki/American_cuisine)–related article is a stub.
